intro: Xanthosia huegelii, commonly known as the Huetzler's wattle, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, adding a striking visual element to its natural habitat. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
